intro: Canthium vanwykii, commonly known as the Van Wyk's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and often striking floral structures. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with bright yellow or orange hues, attracting various pollinators. Canthium vanwykii is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in local remedies.
